description.narrative: ADEPT received pre-core support from the Embassy based on an action plan for implementing the recommendations of the System Based Audit (SBA). Apart from financial support, the Embassy has provided training and coaching on different subject matters to all the CSOs with pre-core support agreements, including ADEPT. The intervention had a technical and preparatory character. The contribution was implemented to support Adept to enhance internal capacities according to the System Based Audit (SBA) Report's recommendations from 2018 and based on reached progress and set objectives from strategic documents - to negotiate a potential core-support. According to the pre-core support Agreement, the partner was evaluated by an independent expert (Swedish Development Advisers) to assess the way the organisation implemented the institutional audit recommendations during pre-core support in 2019. The assessment follow-up report was submitted to the Embassy according to the Agreement.

Det förberedande kärnstödet för Organisationen för Deltagande Demokrati – Adept bereds som en förenklad insats. Syftet med det förberedande kärnstödet är att stärka organisationens kapacitet och utveckla deras interna regelverk.
Adept kommer under denna första fas av stödet (innan kärnstöd) att genomföra de prioriterade rekommendationerna från Nordic Consulting Group presenterade i den systembaserade revisionsrapporten som gjordes 2018. Adept utvecklar institutionell kapacitet, interna rutiner, personalkunskaper och andra färdigheter för att kunna genomföra kärnstödsaktiviteter. Baserat på en kommande uppföljningsrapport som avser aktiviteter under denna första fas (rapport tas preliminärt fram i december 2019) kan Sida sedan överväga att fortsätta med kärnstöd till Adept baserat på en strategisk plan, resultatram och den strategiska budgeten som utvecklats inför kärnstödet.
Insatsens totala budget uppgår till 324 000 SEK.

The pre-core support granted for Association for Participatory Democracy - Adept is a simplified contribution which aims at supporting the organization to develop its internal capacities and policies.
During pre-core support phase Adept will implement priority recommendations provided by the Nordic Consulting Group in the system-based audit report produced in 2018. Therefore, it will develop institutional capacities, internal routines, staff knowledge and skills to be able to implement core-support activities. Based on a follow-up report on pre-core activities to be conducted tentatively in December 2019, Sida may consider continuing with core-support with Adept based on the Strategic Plan, RAF and strategic budget developed during pre-core support.
The interventions' total budget is 324 000 SEK.

description.narrative: Considering the fact that System Based Audit recommendations were considered in the Action Plan for the received pre-core support in 2019, the Follow-up Report for the pre-core support period, elaborated by SDA will serve as a basic assessment for further potential cooperation with Adept. The Embassy's evaluation of further cooperation with the organisation will be determined based on final list of documents drafted or adjusted according to SBA recommendations. The System Based Audit of ADEPT was carried out in September 2018. In the report, a total of 29 recommendations were provided, of which 16 were highlighted as priority recommendations. In that report, priority recommendations refer to: Strategy development and results-based management, Internal governance, Risk management, Management of operations, Financial management and control, and Auditing. At the moment of assessment, from 16 recommendations: 10 were not implemented, 3 were partly implemented and other 3 were considered fully implemented. ADEPT has developed a draft strategic plan called Organisation Strategy Adept 2024. It is based on a Theory of Change and accompanied by a RAF. An advanced draft of the Organisation Strategy was presented to the Board in December 2019. In the draft Organisation Strategy, the cross-cutting perspectives of gender and environment are referred to under the organisational strengthening component. The new RAF, which is also in a draft format, defines ultimate outcomes (impact), intermediary outcomes, outputs and main activities, indicators for each intermediary outcome and most of the outputs, and means of verification. Since no internal regulations for the governing bodies and managers have been developed, ADEPT can be said to have partly implemented priority recommendations. The Statute still contains some ambiguities with regard to the governance structure that should be addressed as part of the next revision. In addition, clarifying the organisational structure and the roles and responsibilities of different staff members appear to be of critical importance.
